Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw and clearly label a specific land or water habitat, such as a forest or pond.
The student can draw and correctly label a variety of plants found in the chosen habitat, including trees, grasses, and bushes.
The student can draw and correctly label different kinds of animals found in the chosen habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, or fish.
The student can illustrate and correctly label how plants and animals are similar or different in two different habitats, such as comparing a forest to a desert.
The student can use their drawing to effectively show patterns in the diversity of life between different habitats, highlighting how some species are unique to specific environments.
CANNOT: Minor gaps or inconsistencies may occur, such as occasional incomplete labeling or slight inaccuracies in species representation (e.g., labels that are initially misspelled but corrected upon review).
